discourse_list.title: Discussing the Licensing of DeFi Patent US11196566 To Sustain MakerDAO Operations in the US

content.content: I’d like to kick off the discussion of MakerDAO licensing the US patent number 11196566 to secure the IP currently used in MakerDAO operations and provide room for growth and expansion into other areas. The licensing of patented technology is inevitable if MakerDAO wants to rapidly grow and expand. Licensing can turn a liability into an asset, and those that procure licensure early on have an inherent advantage. As I understand MakerDAO operations, USDC transfers, Governance Voting  Token Swaps, Borrowing DAI, and Multiplying Collateral currently infringe this patents claims. Anxious to imbibe upon constructive feedback.
content.GPT-summary: The author is proposing that MakerDAO licenses a US patent to secure the IP used in their operations and expand into other areas. The author believes that licensing can turn a liability into an asset and provide an advantage. The post explains which aspects of MakerDAO operations currently infringe on the patent and asks for constructive feedback.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: nycomdiv.com    655003_2019_Charles_Hall_v_Reggie_Middleton_et_al_DECISION_AFTER_TRIAL_149.pdf 230.14 KB      Highlights on recent Dec. 2022 litigation of fraud and patent theft “Additionally, regardless of whether Middleton had fraudulent intent at the outset–that issue is academic–it is clear that his current claim that he was really entitled to personally own the patents is nothing more than revisionist history proffered in an attempt to steal the Company’s primary assets for himself. His evasive and incredible answers to questions on cross-examination and his conduct resulting in the SEC consent order (Dkt. 29 at 866) convince the court that Middleton is willing to misrepresent the facts and render his testimony unworthy of belief.” "Middleton raised millions of dollars by issuing tokens but did so as unregistered securities and coupled with his misappropriation of the patents, his actions have rendered the Company worthless. "
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely negative feedback on proposal

content.content: I will address these two comments, but do not want to expend anergy addressing allegations. This proposal was posted to discuss the facts, not allegations. The link you posted is to a list of  allegations from an adverse party known to attack crypto projects, ie.,Ripple et. al… It is not adjudicated fact, and there was no admitting or denying said allegations. Let’s stick to the facts.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
